author: Gabriel Chan Uicab
title: Fuerte accidente en la avenida 132 de M√©rida; un herido grave
text: M√âRIDA.- Una persona del sexo masculino result√≥ gravemente lesionado luego de volcar con su veh√≠culo en el fraccionamiento Bosques del Poniente de M√©rida. El accidente ocurri√≥ cerca de las 3:30 de la tarde de este jueves. Un lesionado tras volcadura en fraccionamiento Bosques del Poniente Seg√∫n testigos, en la avenida 132 iba transitando un autom√≥vil Tiida que manejaba un muchacho, cuando a la altura de la calle 67A realiz√≥ una maniobra para evitar golpear a un auto que atraves√≥ la mencionada avenida en una zona prohibida. En la maniobra, el conductor del Tiida perdi√≥ el control del volante debido a la velocidad que llevada y de que se trata de una calle curva. El joven se sali√≥ del camino, su veh√≠culo volc√≥ y choc√≥ contra un poste de alumbrado p√∫blico, el cual dobl√≥. Finalmente el veh√≠culo regres√≥ a su posici√≥n normal. Vecinos de la zona indicaron que el muchacho estaba gravemente herido, por lo que tuvo que ser trasladado a un hospital por param√©dicos y bomberos que llegaron a los pocos minutos al accidente. La polic√≠a se qued√≥ al resguardo de la zona y a la espera de un perito de tr√°nsito el cual pondr√≠a a disposici√≥n de la autoridad ministerial el veh√≠culo para los fines legales que corresponden. Vecinos denuncian ‚Äúpeligros‚Äù en avenida 132 de M√©rida Los ciudadanos pidieron el apoyo de las autoridades, pues indicaron que la avenida 132 se ha vuelto muy peligrosa y son constantes los accidentes debido a que unos topes que estaban colocados se fueron deteriorando y ahora, pr√°cticamente ya no existen. Un vecino de la zona dijo que han pedido a las autoridades darle mantenimiento a los topes, pero les dijeron que ‚Äútienen que subirlo a Face‚Äù. author: VNExplorer
title: Mhoni Vidente: Hor√≥scopo de hoy viernes 15 de marzo de 2024
text:
Los efectos de la lluvia de estrellas de marzo 2024 estar√°n m√°s que presentes en algunos signos del zodiaco de acuerdo al hor√≥scopo de hoy viernes 15 de marzo de 2024 de Mhoni Vidente. Ellos tendr√°n todas las oportunidades para triunfar en los terrenos profesionales y personales.
Las energ√≠as positivas estar√°n rodeando a los siguientes signos del zodiaco de acuerdo al hor√≥scopo de hoy viernes 15 de marzo de 2024 de Mhoni Vidente. Ver√° como se vienen cosas buenas para ellos.
Aries: De acuerdo al hor√≥scopo de hoy una expareja podr√≠a invitar algunos chismes sobre ti, as√≠ que no hagas caso y sigue adelante. En los terrenos laborales cuida un poco m√°s tus impulsos, pues se podr√≠an presentar malos ratos. Si eres soltero, podr√≠as encontrar el amor con los signos de Leo y Capricornio.
Tauro: Mhoni Vidente te dice que ser√°n d√≠as de mucha reflexi√≥n sobre todo en las cuestiones laborales, pues est√°s en la b√∫squeda de uno que te haga sentir m√°s pleno. Si tienes pareja no dejes que te dominen los celos.
G√©minis: De acuerdo al hor√≥scopo de hoy si est√°s soltero tendr√°s una conexi√≥n muy fuerte con una nueva persona, pero sin formalizar. Sin embargo, la pasar√°s muy bien. En caso de que sigas estudiando no te detengas, pues la formaci√≥n profesional es muy importante.
C√°ncer: Mhoni Vidente te dice que estar√°s muy estresado en el trabajo, pero todo va a resolverse conforme vayan pasando los d√≠as. Por otro lado, estar√°s planeando un viaje para Semana Santa, no dudes en asistir.
Signo de Acuario. Foto: Pixabay
Leo: De acuerdo al hor√≥scopo de hoy es el momento perfecto para tomar otro trabajo, en caso de que el que tengas no te llene, sobre todo por los conflictos que han surgido √∫ltimamente. En las cuestiones del amor tus signos m√°s compatibles son Aries y Sagitario.
Virgo: Mhoni Vidente te dice que no descuides a tus amigos o familia por estar en el trabajo. As√≠ que debes aprender a tomarte un tiempo libre para visitarlos o solo mandar un mensaje.
Libra: De acuerdo al hor√≥scopo de hoy tendr√°s dudas sobre a quien debes elegir en el amor, pues tendr√°s por lo menos dos prospectos. Ser√°s m√°s compatible con la persona con la que te ries m√°s seguido. En la salud, trata de acudir a una revisi√≥n de rutina para descartar cualquier enfermedad.
Escorpio: Mhoni Vidente te dice que tendr√°s que ser m√°s cauteloso en tu trabajo, pues hay varias personas que no te desean lo mejor. Estar√°s pensando muy seriamente en terminar tu relaci√≥n de pareja, pues te ha dolido todo lo que ha pasado.
Sagitario: De acuerdo al hor√≥scopo de hoy ser√°n tiempos de prosperidad y lo notar√°s en el nuevo proyecto que est√°s iniciando. En las cuestiones del amor, debes prestarle atenci√≥n a personas de los signos Aries y Libra, pues podr√≠a surgir un romance muy interesante. Ser√°n d√≠as de cargarse de energ√≠as positivas.
Capricornio: Mhoni Vidente te dice que debes recordar que no est√°s solo y hay mucha gente a tu lado que te quiere y apoya. Trata de ser m√°s cuidadoso con el dinero y no gastar por gastar. No confundas la prosperidad que vives actualmente. En las cuestiones de salud, comienza nuevos h√°bitos como tomar unos minutos el sol, pues esto va a beneficiarte.
Acuario: De acuerdo al hor√≥scopo de hoy por fin vas a liquidar esa deuda que has arrastrado por a√±os, principalmente porque comenzar√°s a ganar m√°s dinero. En las cuestiones del amor los Tauro y G√©minis ser√°n los signos ideales para tener una buena cita y empezar a tener algo m√°s que una amistad. Trata de tener pensamientos negativos, pues podr√≠as sufrir consecuencias si te domina la negatividad.
Piscis: Mhoni Vidente te dice que en el trabajo habr√° muchos chismes sobre ti, pero no debes prestarle importancia. No gastes tu energ√≠a donde no. Los planes que te propongas saldr√°n a la perfecci√≥n a la medida que evitas el sabotaje. Ten mucho cuidado con eso.

author: Zhao Yimeng
title: China‚Äôs July temperatures set national record - Asia News NetworkAsia News Network
text: August 2, 2024 BEIJING ‚Äì China experienced its hottest month on record in July, with the highest average temperature since the country began releasing comprehensive data in 1961, the China Meteorological Administration said on Thursday. Jia Xiaolong, deputy director of the National Climate Center, said the national average temperature hit a record 23.2 C last month, 1.1 C higher than in the previous hottest July dating back to 1961. ‚ÄúIn July, China encountered a combination of extreme heavy rainfall and extreme high temperatures nationwide,‚Äù Jia said at a news conference in Beijing. Southern China faced a widespread and prolonged heat wave in July, with multiple regions experiencing continuous high temperatures for over 20 days. A total of 59 national meteorological stations recorded daily maximum temperatures that broke or hit historical records. Temperatures above 41 C were observed in places like Cili in Hunan province, Tongshan in Hubei province and Lishui in Zhejiang province, Jia said. Hot weather records were shattered around the world last month, with July 22 being Earth‚Äôs hottest day on record as the global daily average temperature reached 17.15 C. The sudden rise in average daily temperature from July 21 to 22 was mainly due to significantly higher than average temperatures in the Northern Hemisphere, particularly in North America and Europe, as well as most of Antarctica, Jia said. According to forecasts, temperatures in most parts of China will remain higher than usual this month. Two significant heat waves will hit in the first half of August, and the high temperatures are expected to ease late in the month, the CMA said. In July, national average precipitation was 140 millimeters, 15 percent more than in the same period in previous years and the third highest since 1961. The previous two records, when the country was hit by catastrophic floods, were 148 mm in July 1996 and 146.8 mm in July 1998. Frequent heavy rains battered a large expanse of China from north to south last month, with the provinces of Shandong and Jilin receiving their highest precipitation since 1961. Daily precipitation records were broken at 33 national meteorological stations. Among them, Sheqi in Henan province, Hengshan in Hunan province and Pingyi in Shandong saw daily precipitation exceed 300 mm. Jia said the rainy season in North China began on July 22, and on July 30 Beijing experienced its most intense rainfall since the start of flood season. Local authorities urged extra efforts to prevent secondary disasters such as floods and landslides, he said. A total of 2,492 red alerts were issued nationwide in July, an 84 percent increase compared to the average for the month in the previous seven years, he added. Two-thirds of the red alerts were for heavy rain.

author: Liz Roberts
title: Rotherham hotel riot: Asylum seeker who filmed unrest feared for life
text:
An asylum seeker says he thought he was going to die after masked rioters broke into the hotel he was staying in during violent unrest in Rotherham.
Abdullah, an Iraqi Kurd, had been in the UK for four months, having arrived in the country by boat, when the incident took place at the Holiday Inn Express in Manvers.
Footage taken by Abdullah and others from inside the hotel, which came under attack by a large crowd on 4 August - Abdullah's birthday - shows people shouting threats and obscenities at those inside.
Other video filmed by Abdullah shows protesters attacking a police van as well as smashed windows and panic inside the hotel.
PA Media Emergency services workers attended a clean-up operation after rioters smashed windows, started fires and threw objects at the hotel One man, with his face covered, can be seen pulling his finger across his throat to suggest a knife cutting it.
The violence at the hotel - including rioters starting fires - came in the wake of the fatal knife attack in Southport, which left three girls dead. Unrest spread around the country in the aftermath of the stabbings, fuelled by misinformation relating to anti-immigration sentiments on social media.
Abdullah, who asked for his surname not to be used, described being confronted by masked people inside the hotel and how the incident has impacted him since.
He says the violent scenes he witnessed began with two opposing sides protesting outside - but that the pro-immigration protesters were led away from the scene by police when they became outnumbered.
Abdullah told the BBC the incident started around 10:00 BST and lasted "a long time", until around 17:00 or 18:00.
Footage shows crowds outside surging at police lines, throwing rocks and missiles at windows and setting wheelie bins on fire next to broken windows.
In video seen by the BBC, taken by Abdullah, people can be seen trying to overturn a police van. Inside the hotel, debris and smashed glass appears strewn across floors, while one official is heard telling panicked guests to please stay in their rooms, as others rush along the corridor.
‚ÄúWe [were] all scared,‚Äù Abdullah told the BBC. ‚ÄúWe saw everyone kicking the police - that‚Äôs why we are scared, when someone kicks the police, they can kick me too, because we are just a normal person.‚Äù
Video shows security personnel and asylum seekers as hotel is targeted Abdullah had been in a friend‚Äôs room, but he then returned to his own room on the second floor. When he got there, the window had been smashed and his room was full of smoke.
‚ÄúInside is all fire,‚Äù he added. ‚ÄúWe couldn‚Äôt breathe and... we all have stress because we think today we will die.‚Äù
Abdullah said he then went back into the corridor, where he was faced with masked protesters who had broken into the hotel and come up to the second floor.
‚ÄúI go outside of my room and I saw the five people with masks, black masks. I couldn‚Äôt see their faces. And he said ‚Äòcome to me, you want to fight with me?‚Äô. But the police came and he saved me, he protected me.
"If the police weren‚Äôt there, maybe I will be dead. We were scared, all scared‚Ä¶ We couldn‚Äôt think what we could do."
At the time, Prime Minister Sir Keir Starmer condemned the incident as "far-right thuggery".
South Yorkshire Police described the violence as "nothing short of disgusting" and have since said more than 60 officers were injured in the incident, alongside four police dogs and a police horse.
Earlier on Thursday, the force said 38 people had been charged over the unrest, and 20 had been convicted.
Later, three men were jailed over the incident, bringing the number who have been sentenced to 11.
Abdullah has now been moved, like all those housed in the Rotherham hotel.
But the incident has affected him.
Reuters ‚ÄúI‚Äôm still scared, when I go to outside here I‚Äôm still scared. When I see another person I go to the other side. I think it is better because I don‚Äôt want to have any problem, because of what happened‚Ä¶ I can‚Äôt forget it you know.‚Äù
He says he understands why some people feel resentment, but he also knows they do not represent everyone‚Äôs views.
‚ÄúWhat happened in Rotherham, that‚Äôs not right. That‚Äôs all confused people. If I have (made) any mistake, you can say anything, but I (haven‚Äôt made) any mistakes‚Ä¶
"I know why the people are angry, but that‚Äôs not [a reason] to want to kill me‚Äù.
He hopes he will be able to settle in the UK before long.
‚ÄúI want to go to work but I can‚Äôt... maybe after six months or one year I can go to work - I want to have a job, I want to pay tax like everybody.‚Äù
Additional reporting by Harrison Jones
Two more charged over Manvers hotel riot Asylum seekers 'traumatised' after hotel riot Watch: Inside the Rotherham hotel rioters attacked A day in court after the Rotherham riot

author: @gurufocus
title: ARMOUR Residential REIT Inc (ARR) Announces Q1 2025 Financial Results | ARR stock news
text:
Summary
ARMOUR Residential REIT Inc (ARR, Financial) released its unaudited financial results for the first quarter of 2025, reporting a GAAP net income of $24.3 million, or $0.32 per common share. The company also highlighted a net interest income of $36.3 million and distributable earnings of $64.6 million, equating to $0.86 per common share. The financial position as of March 31, 2025, showed a book value per common share of $18.59, a slight decrease from $19.07 at the end of 2024. The press release was issued on April 23, 2025.
Positive Aspects
- GAAP net income of $24.3 million, translating to $0.32 per common share.
- Distributable earnings of $64.6 million, or $0.86 per common share, indicating strong earnings potential.
- Raised $371.4 million through an at-the-market offering program, enhancing capital resources.
- Maintained a robust liquidity position with $848.0 million in cash and unencumbered securities.
- Economic net interest spread of 1.88%, reflecting effective interest rate management.
Negative Aspects
- Book value per common share decreased to $18.59 from $19.07 at the end of 2024.
- Debt to equity ratio increased to 7.33:1, indicating higher leverage.
- Interest rate swap contracts resulted in a loss of $138.9 million.
Financial Analyst Perspective
From a financial analyst's viewpoint, ARMOUR Residential REIT Inc's Q1 2025 results demonstrate a solid performance in terms of net income and distributable earnings. The company's ability to raise significant capital through its at-the-market offering program is a positive indicator of investor confidence. However, the decrease in book value per share and the increased leverage ratio are areas of concern that may require strategic adjustments to maintain financial stability.
Market Research Analyst Perspective
As a market research analyst, the performance of ARMOUR Residential REIT Inc in Q1 2025 reflects a resilient business model in the face of market challenges. The company's focus on maintaining liquidity and managing interest rate risks is commendable. However, the decline in book value and increased leverage could impact investor sentiment. Monitoring these metrics will be crucial for assessing the company's long-term market position and growth potential.
Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)
Q: What was ARMOUR's GAAP net income for Q1 2025?
A: ARMOUR reported a GAAP net income of $24.3 million for Q1 2025.
Q: How much capital did ARMOUR raise through its at-the-market offering program?
A: ARMOUR raised $371.4 million by issuing 19,992,307 shares of common stock.
Q: What was the book value per common share as of March 31, 2025?
A: The book value per common share was $18.59 as of March 31, 2025.
Q: What is ARMOUR's debt to equity ratio?
A: ARMOUR's debt to equity ratio was 7.33:1 as of the end of Q1 2025.
Q: When is the next dividend payment scheduled?
A: A cash dividend of $0.24 per common share is scheduled for payment on April 29, 2025.
 Read the original press release here.

Our commentary is rooted in historical data and analyst projections, utilizing an impartial methodology, and is not intended to serve as specific investment guidance. It does not formulate a recommendation to purchase or divest any stock and does not consider individual investment objectives or financial circumstances. Be aware that our analysis might not incorporate the most recent, price-sensitive company announcements or qualitative information. GuruFocus holds no position in the stocks mentioned herein.

author: Boston 25 News Staff
title: Maine Amber Alert ends after mother, daughter found safe ‚Äì Boston 25 News
text:
By Boston 25 News Staff December 29, 2023 at 6:02 am EST By Boston 25 News Staff December 29, 2023 at 6:02 am EST An Amber Alert for a mother and daughter who were forced into a white SUV in Saco, Maine, on Thursday morning was called off overnight after they were found safe, authorities said.
Three-year-old Angie Rodondi and her mother 35-year-old Norma Rodondi Jimbikt, who live in the Biddeford area, were forced into a white Ford Explorer with a New York registration by a man around 11:30 a.m., according to Maine State Police.
The vehicle was seen crossing into New York state at 3:41 p.m. The Amber Alert was ultimately canceled around 1 a.m. Friday.
‚ÄúNorma Rodondi Jimbikt and her daughter Angie Rodond have been safely located,‚Äù state police wrote in a Facebook post.
State police shared no other information on the situation that prompted the alert.
There were no additional details immediately available.
AMBER ALERT UPDATE Norma Rodondi Jimbikt and her daughter Angie Rodond have been safely located. AMBER ALERT The...
Posted by Maine State Police on Thursday, December 28, 2023 The #Saco #Maine #AMBERAlert has been cancelled. https://t.co/19T3f8azOc

author: Di Redazione Metronews
title: Sport, Barlaam: ‚ÄúConnubio con studio √® molto importante e paga‚Äù
text:
Milano, 5 dic. (Adnkronos) ‚Äì ‚ÄúLo sport insegna un metodo che nello studio paga tanto. A me ha aiutato specialmente alle superiori: quando ho iniziato a prendere lo sport pi√π seriamente, i miei voti sono migliorati e il mio rendimento scolastico ne ha giovato. Quindi √® un connubio molto importante quello tra sport e studio‚Äù. Lo dichiara l‚Äôatleta paralimpico, vincitore di tre ori nel nuoto a Parigi, Simone Barlaam, che questa sera a Milano ha partecipato alla premiazione della settima edizione del concorso ‚ÄòDonna Sport ‚Äì L‚Äôatleta pi√π brava a scuola‚Äô, promosso dal Gruppo Bracco e patrocinato da Coni e Comitato Italiano Paralimpico.
Affiancare sport e studio per√≤ ‚Äúnon √® facile, perch√© lo sport prende gran parte della quotidianit√† di uno sportivo, praticamente come un lavoro a tempo pieno‚Äù. Per questo ‚Äì osserva Barlaam ‚Äúfa tanto onore a uno sportivo riuscire a distinguersi e a sfruttare l‚Äôorganizzazione dello sport nella quotidianit√† e nello studio. Ed √® una cosa che paga‚Äù.
Per i giovani atleti che studiano ‚Äúil supporto di aziende come il Gruppo Bracco √® importantissimo. Fare molti sport in Italia √® complicato, specialmente quando si √® pi√π giovani‚Äù e sono necessarie ‚Äúattrezzature molto costose‚Äù. Per questo √® prezioso ‚Äúavere delle aziende cos√¨ che sostengono i giovani per permettere loro di esprimersi nel modo migliore nello sport‚Äù.
